Hard Tanh¶

class layers.activation.HardTanh.HardTanh[source]¶

Implements the Hard Tanh activation layer.

The Hard Tanh is a computationally cheaper, piecewise linear approximation of the standard Tanh function. Its formula is f(x) = max(-1, min(1, x)).

It is faster to compute than Tanh and avoids the use of exponentials.

input¶

Stores the input from the forward pass, which is needed to calculate the gradient in the backward pass.

Type:

np.ndarray

backward(grad_output)[source]¶

Performs the backward pass of the layer.

The derivative of Hard Tanh is 1 in the linear region between -1 and 1, and 0 otherwise.

Parameters:

grad_output (np.ndarray) – The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s output.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s input.

  • None, since Hard Tanh has no trainable parameters.

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, None]

forward(input_data)[source]¶

Performs the forward pass of the layer.

Parameters:

input_data (np.ndarray) – The input data from the previous layer.

Returns:

The output of the layer after applying the Hard Tanh function.

Return type:

np.ndarray
